channel.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
channel.description: I made a fun pk and everything is good until you click attack to attack the person. It says that person is not in the wildy. I do have the coors in the inWild method tho. Help?

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“EmulousGuru, post:14, topic:363382”]Do you still have the FunPK’s coordinates in the wilderness boolean?

If so, that’s why.[/quote]

public boolean inFunPK() { if(absX > 2595 && absX < 2603 && absY > 3379 && absY < 3393) { return true; } return false; }
I have it in the client.java but do I have to have it in a specific place?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

Do you still have the FunPK’s coordinates in the wilderness boolean?

If so, that’s why.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

EmulousGuru:

I think it’s the interface 201.

Nope. 201 = duel arena battleaxe at bottom right corner.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

I think it’s the interface 201.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“EmulousGuru, post:10, topic:363382”]My bad, wasn’t paying attention to the code.
This should work:

if(inWild()) { if(!inFunPK()) { int modY = absY > 6400 ? absY - 6400 : absY; wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1); getPA().walkableInterface(197); } if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) { if(inMulti()) { getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199); } else { getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199); } } else { getPA().multiWay(-1); getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199); } getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1); } else if (inDuelArena()) { getPA().walkableInterface(201); if(duelStatus == 5) { getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1); } else { getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Challenge", 1); } } else if(inFunPK()) { getPA().walkableInterface(201); getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1); } [/quote]
Has “Attack” option but still has wildy level difference.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

My bad, wasn’t paying attention to the code.
This should work:

                if(inWild()) {
                        if(!inFunPK()) {
                                int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
                                wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1);
                                getPA().walkableInterface(197);
                        }                              
                        if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
                                if(inMulti()) {
                                        getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
                                } else {
                                        getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
                                }
                        } else {
                                getPA().multiWay(-1);
                                getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
                        }
                        getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
                } else if (inDuelArena()) {
                        getPA().walkableInterface(201);
                        if(duelStatus == 5) {
                                getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
                        } else {
                                getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Challenge", 1);
                        }
				} else if(inFunPK()) {
					getPA().walkableInterface(201);
					getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
				}

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

Doesn’t work. It just gives the “Challange” option.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

The attack option is below that.
Try this:

		if(inWild()) {
			if(!inFunPK()) {
				int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
				wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1);
				getPA().walkableInterface(197);
			}				
			if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
				if(inMulti()) {
					getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
				} else {
					getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
				}
			} else {
				getPA().multiWay(-1);
				getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
			}
			getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
		} else if (inDuelArena() || inFunPK()) {
			getPA().walkableInterface(201);
			if(inFunPK()) {
				getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
			}
			if(duelStatus == 5) {
				getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
			} else {
				getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Challenge", 1);
			}

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“EmulousGuru, post:6, topic:363382”]Find the wild level method,

if(inWild()) {
        int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
	wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1);
	getPA().walkableInterface(197);

And change it to:

if(inWild() && !inFunPK()) {
        int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
	wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1);
	getPA().walkableInterface(197);

Then declare the inFunPK boolean in client class.

public boolean inFunPK() { if(absX > 2595 && absX < 2603 && absY > 3379 && absY < 3393) { return true; } return false; } [/quote]
Did that. Now there is no “Attack” option.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

Find the wild level method,

if(inWild()) {
        int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
	wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1);
	getPA().walkableInterface(197);

And change it to:

if(inWild() && !inFunPK()) {
        int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
	wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1);
	getPA().walkableInterface(197);

Then declare the inFunPK boolean in client class.

public boolean inFunPK() {
        if(absX > 2595 && absX < 2603 && absY > 3379 && absY < 3393) {      
            return true;
        }
	return false;
}

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

How do I make an exception for the wilderness level for funpk?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

[quote=“Impious Lols, post:3, topic:363382”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=459637.msg3363061#msg3363061 date=1286567030]

        public boolean inWild() {
                if(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 ||
                   absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366) {       
                        return true;
                }
                if(absX > 2595 && absX < 2603 && absY > 3379 && absY < 3393) {       
                        return true;
                }
                return false;
        }

[/quote]
How do I make it so people can attack in it but no level range?[/quote]
CombatAssistant.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”] public boolean inWild() { if(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 || absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366) { return true; } if(absX > 2595 && absX < 2603 && absY > 3379 && absY < 3393) { return true; } return false; } [/quote]
How do I make it so people can attack in it but no level range?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Fun PK Help[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

Show the code you added?

How about this.
How do I add

public boolean inFunPk() { return (absX > 2595 && absX < 2603 && absY > 3379 && absY < 3393); }
to

public boolean inWild() { if(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 || (absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366)) { return true; } return false; }
